title: Library Contract Request: HeinOnline database (Michigan State University) (Michigan State University)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with William S. Hein & Co. relating to the licensing of the “HeinOnline” database;
2) All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and
3) All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with William S. Hein & Co. for the “HeinOnline” database. 

Please do not limit your search to strictly direct agreements or renewals between the institution and William S. Hein & Co., but include any agreements and related documentation through consortia such as the Midwest Collaborative for Library Services (MCLS), the Big Ten Academic Alliance (BTAA), or Lyrasis.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the “HeinOnline” database.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ellen Dubinsky
